title: NGT seeks report from govt.on safety in firecracker units
content: A total of 134 people died and 89 were injured in accidents at firecracker units in Virudhunagar district alone since 2022; the Bench observed that most accidents could have been prevented

title: Naidu for North Andhra soon to fast-track irrigation projects, says Minister Ramanaidu
content: The Chief Minister has already directed officials to complete all major projects within the next two years with an outlay of over ₹2,000 crore, he says

title: A small plaque in Mylapore that keeps alive Rabindranath  Tagore’s first visit to Madras
content: While visiting Madras in 1919, the Nobel laureate stayed at the residence of Justice T. Muthuswamy Iyer, the first Indian to serve as a judge of the Madras High Court during the British period. In 2005, the descendants of Iyer sold the house to S. H. Mohideen  and his family, which chose to retain its historic name as a matter of pride

title: Pavalar Varadharajan, an artist who played key role in Communist Party’s victory in Kerala
content: The Devikulam by-election in 1958 was crucial for the Namboodiripad government. To tap into plantation workers who were mostly Tamils, the Communist Party organised concerts by Pavalar Varadharajan, whose songs went down very well with electors

title: Batting for the girls: Tamil Nadu’s pioneering measures to encourage women’s cricket
content: What the Women in Blue pulled off at DY Patil Stadium, Navi Mumbai, on November 2 rests on the hard work that a small army of Chennai women did over five decades ago. Shilu Ranganathan was the spearhead, who served the Tamil Nadu Women’s Cricket Association that organised tournaments at the school, collegiate, State and national levels

title: CBI registers FIR against ex-Punjab DGP, his wife in connection with their son’s death
content: The Haryana government requested the Centre to hand over the probe to the CBI. The case was earlier registered at the Mansa Devi Complex, District Panchkula, Haryana

title: Two Census apps, test portal for self-enumeration go live
content: Enumerators have been trained to use apps to help in digital collection and faster processing of Census data; the self-enumeration portal is open to the public in pre-test areas from November 1 to 7

title: Bengaluru’s auto, cab drivers’ screen addiction raise alarm over road safety
content: According to police data, 34,303 cases were registered between January and September 2025 against motorists for using mobile phones while driving.

title: Mixed response to T.N. govt.’s proposed SOP for public meetings, rallies, road shows
content: Communist Party of India (Marxist) and Tamilaga Vazhvurimai Katchi were among the parties that completely rejected the SOP features proposed by the Tamil Nadu government

title: Panneerselvam camp mulling the option of joining hands with DMK
content: One view that is being expressed in the camp is that those who were in the AIADMK had either joined the DMK or became a constituent of the front headed by the Dravidian major

title: Tamil and Russian literature deeply influenced my visual storytelling, says Mari Selvaraj
content: In a freewheeling conversation, the acclaimed director reflects on the values his formative years instilled in him and discusses the content, casting decisions, and the symbolic portrayal of B.R. Ambedkar in his films

title: Govt. school campus remains slushy after NHAI demolition work
content: The situation remains bad for over a month after NHAI demolished a portion of the school compound wall and eight unused classrooms

title: Mystery lingers as a peaceful protest takes a violent turn in Kozhikode
content: The residents of Ambayathode village in Kozhikode, who have been peacefully protesting for six years against a poultry waste treatment plant, were recently caught in the middle of an arson and police action that resulted in heavy damage to property and injuries to many people. The dust has settled somewhat, but the villagers’ complaints about pollution persist. Mithosh Joseph attempts to get to the bottom of the issue

title: Enrolling as a voter immediately on turning 18 could overwhelm authorities: Bombay HC
content: If every person starts enrolling as a voter as soon as they turn 18, the EC may have to verify each application, opening floodgates, the court said

title: As the next phase of SIR rolls on, the case of Assam
content: By skipping Assam for Special Intensive Revision, the Election Commission of India conveniently avoids questions as to its jurisdiction as a citizenship verification authority

title: Commuters have a harrowing time on  metro’s diversion roads in Kochi
content: Concern over shoddy condition of roads in NH Bypass-Puthiya Road-Vennala-Palachuvadu-Seaport Airport Road corridor

title: Woman harassed on KSRTC bus in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The woman recorded the video of the harassment and slapped the man on the bus. He was later disembarked from the bus

title: Skill development can’t be looked only from a job or economy point of view: Subroto Bagchi
content: While countries like South Korea and Japan have over 80% formally skilled workers, India has less than 5% skilled workers

title: Rahul Gandhi's presser puts spotlight on Brazilian woman; Internet abuzz with her reaction
content: Mr. Gandhi said a "centralised plan" included a Brazilian model whose photograph was used 22 times at 10 booths in the Rai constituency during last year's Haryana Assembly polls

title: Karnataka High Court directs government to develop unified and technology-driven platform for Bengaluru’s sold waste management
content: In an era where technology offers unprecedented tools for transparency and accountability the continued reliance on archaic, non-transparent methods is no longer tenable, said the court

title: Watch | Coimbatore gang rape: A disturbing pattern behind sexual crimes
content: A shocking gang rape of a college girl in Coimbatore has shaken Tamil Nadu is not an isolated crime. It’s part of a disturbing pattern — attacks on women seen in public with male companions, often involving offenders with a criminal past or even juveniles. Why do such crimes keep repeating?

title: Ex-WR Brown arrested in Dubai, extradited to U.S.
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown was arrested on an attempted murder charge stemming from a shooting after a celebrity boxing event in Miami in May.

title: Sources: OF Tucker among 13 to get $22M offer
content: Kyle Tucker (Cubs) and Kyle Schwarber (Phillies) headline the 13 players who were tendered the $22.025 million qualifying offer Thursday, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones enters not guilty plea in NBA gambling case
content: Former NBA player and assistant coach Damon Jones pleaded not guilty Thursday to charges he profited from rigged poker games and provided sports bettors with nonpublic information about injuries to stars LeBron James and Anthony Davis.

title: Cowboys' Kneeland dies in apparent suicide at 24
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland died Thursday morning from an apparent suicide following a police pursuit and vehicle crash, according to authorities.

title: Odunze: Dad's shots at Bears don't speak for me
content: Chicago Bears wide receiver Rome Odunze said Thursday his father James' posts on social media are his prerogative, but that they don't speak for him.

title: Sources: DePodesta to run Rockies' baseball ops
content: The Rockies are finalizing a deal to hire Paul DePodesta to run their baseball operations department, sources told ESPN, turning to the longtime executive to overhaul a stagnant organization coming off a 119-loss season.

title: Blues goalie had 'full intention' to give Ovi puck
content: Blues goaltender Jordan Binnington said he fully intended to give Capitals star Alex Ovechkin his 900th goal puck back after hiding it down his pants.

title: Wisconsin's Fickell to return in 2026, AD says
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell will return to lead the Badgers in 2026, athletic director Chris McIntosh announced on Thursday.

content: How much will the biggest stars get paid this winter? Kiley McDaniel breaks down the 2025-26 free agent class.

content: The future Hall of Famer has hung up his spikes, but as L.A.'s dynasty continues, so will his influence.

title: Lindsey Harding, an incredible journey to the Lakers' bench and an unprecedented next step
content: She was the No. 1 pick in the 2007 WNBA draft. She has played all over the world and coached through triumph and horror. Now, Harding is not only a leading voice for JJ Redick, LeBron and the Lakers, but is on the short list for future NBA head coaches.

content: Who has been the most lethal forward in Europe this season? A little-known striker in the Latvian league.

content: With only months before the start of the World Cup, can the United States -- even with some key absences -- finish the year on a high note?

content: The Commanders QB is one of the league's best young players -- and its most-hit over the past two years.

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his original wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list of opponents with ESPN.

title: Can anyone stop Kansas City? How each team will, won't win it all
content: It's playoff time in the NWSL, but can anyone stop the Kansas City Current from cruising to the title? Here's how every team could win it all -- and the one thing that might hold each of them back.

title: Gardner grants Colts jerseys to young Jets fans who lamented his departure in viral video
content: A video went viral this week of a father informing his two young sons that one of their favorite players had been traded, with one breaking into tears.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the São Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG eye Barcelona defender García
content: Paris Saint-Germain are keeping tabs on a possible move for Barcelona defender Eric García. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Rockstar Games delays GTA 6 to November 2026
content: The much-anticipated release of the next game in the Grand Theft Auto franchise will require a longer wait than expected ... again.

title: Tamil Nadu officials study Guntur’s waste-to-energy model
content: The representatives Jindal Urban Waste Management Plant give a detailed presentation on the plant’s capacity, waste collection sources, power generation, sales, and ash management processes

title: NBA releases ₹3 crore to red sanders growers in A.P. under ABS mechanism
content: The amount has been disbursed to 199 beneficiaries, covering 198 farmers from Andhra Pradesh and cultivators of red sanders, along with University of Andhra

title: India to question citizens who worked in Myanmar cyberscam centres
content: Officials say the people who are being flown back will not be allowed to go back home immediately as the relevant investigating agencies are trying to find out more details about how they ended up there and what activities they had participating in

title: Minimally-invasive glucose monitoring device developed at IIT-M
content: The system, which displays glucose readings directly on the patch, is designed to function on low power, extending battery life and reducing the frequency of charging

title: Supreme Court condones CBI’s 1,373-day delay in challenging  Amit Jogi’s acquittal in 22-year old murder case
content: Former CM’s son was accused in 2003 murder of NCP leader; acquitted by trial court in 2007; when CBI appealed in 2011, HC said it was too late; Justice Mehta says SC should examine if States can appeal independently of CBI

title: Two dead, three injured in Mumbai train accident
content: The incident occurred around 7 p.m., when four passengers were hit by local train near the pole between Sandhurst Road Railway Station and CSMT station.

title: Record 64.66% voting in first phase of Bihar polls
content: Polling was peaceful, says Election Commission; turnout surpasses 62.57% recorded in 2000 Assembly election; BJP says high polling shows people’s faith in NDA; the grand alliance interprets it as a ‘wave of change’

title: Communication of grounds of arrest in writing in accused’s language is a must: Supreme Court
content: Supplied within reasonable time, this is irrespective of the nature of the offence or statute involved, the apex court has held

title: Bihar Assembly elections Phase 1: Tejashwi, Tej Pratap among candidates who faced tough fight
content: Yadav clan’s family feud became political as both Tejashwi and Tej Pratap put candidates against each other

title: Soon, citizens can be a traffic police personnel for a day
content: Under the programme, citizens will be selected by the police after reviewing applications. The criteria are yet to be finalised

title: SIT arrests former Thiruvabharanam Commissioner in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: K.S. Baiju, who retired as the Thiruvabharanam Commissioner of the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) in July 2019, is the seventh accused in the case. Investigators say that Baiju committed a deliberate lapse by being absent from Sabarimala while gold-plated copper plates on the Dwarapalaka idols were dismantled and handed over to the sponsor of the gold-plating work in 2019

title: Woman with muscular dystrophy to appear for equivalency exam at home
content: Permission given considering the 32-year-old Thrissur native’s case as a special one, says Sivankutty

title: Bihar polls: flooded roads, 20-year wait for booth to return to village as voters bat for democracy
content: In Darbhanga’s Kusheshwar Asthan constituency, voters braved flooded roads and difficult terrain to cast their votes, many with their children in tow; in Munger’s Bhimbandh, part of the Maoist-hit Tarapur seat, residents queued up with visible relief and excitement as a polling booth had finally returned to their village after 20 years

title: IIT Patna student wins hackathon
content: Adhithyan V.P. wins first prize for developing an artificial intelligence-powered co-pilot that unifies Jira, GitHub, and Teams to predict risks, optimise workloads, and ensure compliance through intelligent automation

title: U.S. deports promoter of Indian ‘realty firm’ accused of swindling ₹2,000 crore
content: Praveen Kumar Kapoor has been absconding along with two other promoter-directors of the SRS Group, Jitender Kumar Garg, and Sunil Jindal, for several years.

title: People-centred approach to food systems need of the hour: Shakuntala Haraksingh Thilsted
content: Four-day International Conference on Agrarian Change, organised by the Foundation for Agrarian Studies, opens at Kovalam

title: Modi, Shah engage in real ‘jungle raj’ by misuse of ED, CBI: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress leader alleged that the Prime Minister “only knows how to spread hatred” and is “pitting people against each other in the name of religion and caste” to win elections

title: NDA headed for 'record-breaking victory' in Bihar: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Rahul Gandhi is already ‘preparing excuses, talking about vote chori’, the Union Minister for Agriculture said in Jehanabad district

title: Venu a victim of  collapse of ‘Arogyakeralam,’ says Satheesan
content: Kollam native had died at the Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital on Wednesday night

title: CEO conducts training for Collectors, District Election Officers in Andhra Pradesh on SIR-2026
content: Underlining the need for such an exercise, with the last such conducted 21 years ago, Vivek Yadav says it is the DEOs’ responsibility to assess the need to identify new polling stations by duly considering the fact that no polling station should have more than 1,200 electors

title: Is presence at protest a criminal act, Delhi riots accused asks Supreme Court
content: Shadab Ahmed said the case against him banks on the depositions of police witnesses and referred to two protected witnesses, codenamed Radium and Sodium, arraigned to buttress the police case

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Various fronts in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation finalise candidates
content: CPI(M) district committee meets on Thursday to finalise its candidates. Party will not be declaring any Mayor candidate before the elections

title: Only ‘revolution’ is Congress coming back to power in 2028: D.K. Shivakumar
content: Dismissing talk about the “November Revolution”, Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has said that the “true revolution” will be Congress coming back to power in 2028”

title: Northern Discom takes up automation of feeder monitoring to minimise downtime in power supply
content: CMD Varun Reddy says the new technology helps engineers identify faulty points to take up restoration work without delay

title: Cabinet gives clearance for building annexe for Nyaya Grama on four acres of land on Hebbal campus
content: The State Cabinet on Thursday gave approval for handing over four acres of land on the Hebbal campus of the Karnataka Veterinary, Animal and Fisheries Sciences University to the judiciary for the construction of residential quarters for judges of the High Court of Karnataka

title: First phase of Palayam market redevelopment to be completed in nine months
content: Redevelopment activities will be carried out within the market area by retaining the 19th century arched gate, which is considered as one of the heritage monuments of the city

title: Trump Vs Zohran Mamdani: US President's Newest Showdown
content: Donald Trump loves few things more than tackling a new political foe. But has he met his match in New York's incoming mayor Zohran Mamdani?

title: Ukraine Says Talks With US On Tomahawk Missiles "Positive"
content: Ukraine is engaged in "positive" talks about buying Tomahawk missiles and other long-range weaponry with the United States, Ukraine's ambassador to the US, Olha Stefanishyna, told Bloomberg News on Thursday.

title: Uttarakhand Engineer Dies By Suicide Over Stock Market Loss: Cops
content: An engineer allegedly committed suicide by locking himself in a smoke-filled room here, after incurring heavy losses in the stock market, police said on Thursday.

title: Tesla Shareholders Approve $1 Trillion Pay Package For Elon Musk
content: Tesla shareholders on Thursday overwhelmingly endorsed a massive pay package for CEO Elon Musk that could reach $1 trillion.

title: COP30: World Leaders Launch Fund To Save Forests, Get First $5 Billion
content: World leaders attending a climate summit in Brazil launched a fund Thursday to save the world's forests, quickly raking in over $5 billion in pledges to reward tropical countries for not chopping down trees.

title: US Top Court Backs Trump On Transgander, Non-Binary Passport Rules
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday allowed President Donald Trump's administration to enforce a policy blocking transgender and nonbinary people from choosing passport sex markers that align with their gender identity.

title: Veteran Actor-Singer Sulakshana Pandit Dies At 71
content: Veteran actor and playback singer Sulakshana Pandit, known for movies like "Uljhan" and "Chehre Pe Chehra", died on Thursday due to cardiac arrest, brother Lalit Pandit confirmed the news. She was 71.

title: UN Removes Sanctions On Syria's President Ahead Of Meeting With Trump
content: The United Nations Security Council removed sanctions on Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa, who is due to meet US President Donald Trump at the White House on Monday.

title: Trump Hints At Possible India Visit Next Year Amid Trade Logjam
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi, calling him "a great man" and "a friend," while hinting that he may visit India next year as part of ongoing efforts to strengthen trade relations between the two nations.

title: Manipur Journalists' Union Seeks PUCL's Apology Over Report, Says Will File Criminal Defamation
content: Manipur's biggest union of journalists has sent a legal notice to a Delhi-based non-profit that had commissioned a report into the Meitei-Kuki ethnic clashes.

title: "Evil Woman": Trump Reacts To Nancy Pelosi's Retirement
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday called leading Democratic opponent Nancy Pelosi an "evil woman" after she announced that she would step down from Congress at the next election.

title: In DMK Meet, MK Stalin's Direct Message To Partymen, Subtle Message To BJP
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has issued a stern warning to DMK office-bearers in Tirunelveli and nearby constituencies, urging them to ensure victory in the upcoming elections or risk losing their party positions.

title: 5 Killed In Fresh Clashes Along Afghanistan-Pakistan Border
content: Five people were killed and six were wounded in brief cross-border fire between Afghanistan and Pakistan on Thursday, a hospital official on the Afghan side told AFP, in an incident both countries blamed on each other.

title: Man Robbed, Loses Leg. Cops Take Him To Hospital, Leave Limb Behind
content: A labourer was robbed of Rs 500 by four men and his leg was held on a railway track until a train ran over it, severing the limb, in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Wednesday.

title: RJD Plans Chaos: Nitish Kumar's Deputy On Face-Off With Opposition Leader
content: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha, after a day of run-ins with Rashtriya Janata Dal leaders, supporters and the police, reiterated the intention to run "bulldozers" over criminal elements and accused the police of laxity.

title: US Teacher Shot By 6-Year-Old Awarded $10 Million In Civil Trial
content: A Virginia school teacher who was shot by her 6-year-old student in 2023 was awarded $10 million in damages by a jury on Thursday, concluding a negligence lawsuit she brought against a school administrator.

title: "Deleted From Delhi Voter List": Ex MP Rakesh Sinha's Reply To Opposition Attacks
content: Former BJP Rajya Sabha MP Rakesh Sinha launched a counter attack on political rivals for what he said was trying to create a controversy where there was none, as the first phase of the two-phase Bihar assembly election ended on Thursday.

title: BJP MLA Calls For Fresh Polls In Manipur If Centre Fails To Form Government
content: Manipur BJP MLA L Rameshwor Meetei on Thursday said if the Centre fails to form a government in the state, fresh elections should be conducted.

title: Former Sabarimala Top Official Arrested In Gold Theft Case
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the Sabarimala gold plating theft case on Thursday night recorded the arrest of KS Byju, a former employee of the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), marking the fourth arrest in the case.

title: Class 10 Student Who Skipped School Over Bad Grades Found In Delhi Gurdwara
content: A 14-year-old boy, who went missing from the main gate of his school in Delhi, was found inside Nanak Piao Gurdwara where he had gone seeking shelter and food after skipping classes over poor academic performance, police said on Thursday.

title: NHL prospect pipeline rankings: Sharks, Islanders, then ...?
content: a player who is under 23, with under 50 NHL games played, is eligible for this list . the rankings are done by assigning a value to each of the prospects based on his NHL projection and taking the cumulative value of each team's prospects . this means some teams with many prospects might rank higher than others with fewer, but more talented prospects.

title: Follow live: Jeanty scores 4-yard TD as Raiders get on the board
content: DENVER -- The  Denver Broncos  (7-2) are hosting the  Las Vegas Raiders  (2-6) in a  showdown  of AFC West rivals going in opposite directions. The division-leading Broncos have won six games in a row since a 1-2 start, with four of those victories coming in fourth-quarter comebacks. The Raiders have lost six of their last seven, including an  overtime defeat  to the Jaguars in which their game-winning two-point conversion attempt was unsuccessful. Our two team reporters -- Ryan McFadden for the Raiders and Jeff Legwold for the Broncos -- were at Empower Field at Mile High and provided updates on all the biggest plays and highlights.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Sunil Chhetri on verge of retirement; here’s what he told India manager Khalid Jamil
content: Veteran Indian footballer Sunil Chhetri is contemplating retirement at the end of the 2025-26 ISL season, contingent on Bengaluru FC not winning the title and securing continental qualification.  Having recently ended his international career, Chhetri expressed no regrets about his comeback, though he lamented India's failure to qualify for the Asian Cup.

title: Suryakumar Yadav loses his temper at Shivam Dube during 4th T20I vs Australia
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav showed rare frustration during the fourth T20I against Australia. Despite this brief moment, India secured a crucial 48-run victory, leveling the series. Washington Sundar's exceptional bowling performance led to a dramatic Australian collapse, securing the win for India.

title: US jury finds 'Sandwich guy' not guilty of assaulting border agent with sub
content: A US protester, Sean Dunn, was found not guilty of assaulting a CBP agent with a sandwich. Prosecutors, under a Trump-ordered crackdown, sought felony charges, but a jury acquitted him of a misdemeanor. The defense argued the prosecution was an abuse of power, questioning if throwing a soft object constituted an offense.

title: 'I would have dropped out of college if...': Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to Mark Zuckerberg
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on generative AI and their entrepreneurial journeys. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out of college like Zuckerberg, given Nvidia's long path to becoming a $5 trillion company.

title: 'You shut up ...': Ravi Shastri's epic advice to young Sachin amid Aussie sledging
content: Ravi Shastri recounted a fiery 1991-92 tour of Australia, advising an 18-year-old Sachin Tendulkar to let his bat do the talking amidst Australian sledging.  Shastri himself had a verbal spat with Mike Whitney, but urged Tendulkar, who was eager to retaliate, to rely on his immense talent. This advice shaped Tendulkar's legendary career against Australia.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Is Jalen Green playing tonight vs Clippers? Latest update on Suns star’s status
content: Phoenix Suns guard Jalen Green is poised for his season debut against the Los Angeles Clippers on Thursday, having recovered from a hamstring injury.  Green, a key acquisition in the Kevin Durant trade, is expected to start, forming a dynamic backcourt with Devin Booker. His return bolsters the Suns, who have started the season 3-5.

title: Dodgers eye $80M ex-Cubs champion to boost roster and title hopes
content: Former MVP Cody Bellinger is reportedly a target for a blockbuster reunion with the Los Angeles Dodgers. After a strong showing with the Yankees, Bellinger opted out of his contract, making him a highly sought-after free agent. His return would bolster the Dodgers' lineup and defense, potentially aiding their championship aspirations.

title: Marshawn Kneeland girlfriend: Who is Catalina, the woman who loved the late Cowboys star?
content: The NFL community mourns Marshawn Kneeland, a promising 24-year-old Dallas Cowboys defensive end. His girlfriend, Catalina, alerted police during his final moments, revealing his struggles. Their relationship was private, built on mutual respect and shared values. Catalina, an entrepreneur, was his grounding force, supporting his career and remaining a private figure even after his tragic passing.

title: Gisele Bündchen Says Prioritizing Tom Brady Took a Personal Toll
content: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: Cardiologist reveals 9 proven ways to lower blood pressure naturally
content: High blood pressure can silently damage the heart, kidneys, and brain over time. Dr Evan Levine, a leading cardiologist, explains nine effective ways to bring blood pressure under control—without relying on medication. From improving diet balance to managing sleep and stress, these small yet powerful lifestyle changes can help maintain a healthy heart rhythm and blood flow naturally.

title: Bihar polls: Phase 1 sees 'historic' 64.6% turnout; dy CM's convoy attacked - key points
content: Bihar's first election phase saw a record 64.66% voter turnout, with enthusiastic participation from women. Despite peaceful polling, stray incidents of violence and accusations between leaders, including deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar, were reported. Prashant Kishor's party also made its presence felt, advocating for prohibition law repeal.

title: Marshawn Kneeland’s heartfelt tribute to his late mother resurfaces after death
content: Dallas Cowboys player Marshawn Kneeland, 24, tragically passed away after a vehicle pursuit. His journey was deeply influenced by his late mother, Wendy, and his father, Shawn. Marshawn often spoke of fulfilling a promise to his mother, carrying her ashes as a constant reminder of her unwavering support and belief in his NFL dream.

title: Sulakshana Pandit passes away at 71 after cardiac arrest; funeral to be held tomorrow
content: Veteran singer and actor Sulakshana Pandit, known for her soulful voice and memorable performances in Hindi cinema, passed away on Thursday, November 6, at the age of 71. The singer breathed her last at Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai after a prolonged illness. Her brother, music composer Lalit Pandit, confirmed the heartbreaking news.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma turns prankster; ex-India pacer surprised
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma, currently on a break from Tests and T20Is, shared a hilarious prank video on social media. He tricked friends, including cricketers Shardul Thakur and Dhawal Kulkarni, with an electric shock pen, eliciting hearty laughter. This lighthearted moment comes as Sharma prepares for upcoming ODI matches against South Africa.

title: Voting in Delhi then Bihar? Oppn targets BJP leaders; Rakesh Sinha hits back
content: Opposition parties have accused right-wing leaders of voting in multiple states, citing Rakesh Sinha and others as examples of alleged vote theft.  AAP and RJD claim Sinha voted in both Delhi and Bihar elections. Sinha has denied the accusations, saying his voter registration was transferred to Bihar and threatening legal action for defamation.

title: ED attaches Raina, Dhawan's Rs 11.14cr assets - what we know so far
content: The Enforcement Directorate has provisionally attached assets worth Rs 11.14 crore belonging to former cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan. The action stems from an investigation into the illegal offshore betting platform 1xBet, which promoted betting through surrogate brands. Both cricketers allegedly entered endorsement agreements with foreign entities to promote 1xBet, with payments channelled through foreign entities to conceal illicit origins.

title: Mumbai: Two dead, three injured in local train accident amid strike
content: Two people died and three were injured when a suburban train struck them near Sandhurst Road railway station in Mumbai. The incident followed a protest by railway unions that disrupted services. This disruption caused overcrowding and stranded passengers. The protest was against an FIR filed in connection with a previous train accident.

title: Indians are the kind of immigrants US needs more of - why Trump should take notice
content: New research reveals Indian immigrants are potentially the most economically beneficial group in the US, significantly reducing national debt and boosting GDP. The study highlights how education and skilled visas, like H-1B, drive substantial fiscal contributions, urging policy reforms to prioritize high-skilled immigration for economic growth and debt reduction.

title: India yet to lose T20I series under coach Gambhir: A look at his streak
content: India secured a commanding 48-run victory against Australia in the fourth T20I. This win gives India a 2-1 series lead. Under coach Gautam Gambhir, the team remains unbeaten in the T20 series. India posted 167/8, with Shubman Gill scoring 46. Washington Sundar took three wickets. Australia was bowled out for 119. India's T20 unit appears strong.

title: 'My final year of service': Nancy Pelosi says she won't seek re-election to Congress - video
content: Veteran Democrat Nancy Pelosi, 85, announced she will not seek re-election to Congress after four decades, concluding her term as the first female Speaker of the House. Her departure follows a significant political victory with California's congressional map reshaping. Pelosi's influential career included steering major legislation and leading impeachments of Donald Trump.

title: ' Criminal ... drunk!' Bihar dy CM, RJD leader hurl insults over convoy attack - watch
content: Bihar deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar engaged in a heated exchange during the first phase of elections. Sinha alleged his convoy was attacked with cow dung, while Kumar accused Sinha of intimidating voters. Both leaders traded insults, with Sinha blaming Kumar's men for stopping their vehicle and engaging in hooliganism.

title: Ashton Jeanty injury update: Will the Raiders rookie play vs Broncos tonight?
content: Rookie running back Ashton Jeanty is poised to be a key player for the Raiders against the Broncos. Despite a challenging season for Las Vegas, Jeanty's impressive stats, including significant rushing and receiving yards, highlight his potential. The Raiders face a tough Denver defense in a crucial Thursday Night Football matchup.

title: Pak breaks truce again: Civilian areas shelled, says Kabul; peace talks on
content: Pakistan has reportedly violated the ceasefire by firing into Afghanistan, even as officials meet in Istanbul for renewed talks with Taliban representatives. This comes after a previous agreement for a ceasefire and a monitoring mechanism, following deadly border clashes. The ongoing discussions aim to de-escalate tensions between the neighbours.

title: Rashmika and Vijay’s wedding date revealed; destination wedding in Udaipur - Report
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are reportedly planning a grand wedding. Following a private engagement last October, the couple is rumored to be tying the knot on February 26, 2026. Reports suggest a royal destination wedding in Udaipur. Fans eagerly await confirmation from the popular actors. Both stars have upcoming film projects.

title: 'GOAT': Ex-Aus captain hails Kohli; calls him 'once-in-a-generation' player
content: Former Australian captain Steve Waugh has hailed Virat Kohli as the "greatest one-day player of all time" and a "once-in-a-generation" talent. Waugh praised Kohli's batting prowess and consistency in limited-overs cricket, noting his record 51 ODI centuries. He also commented on India's evolving T20 setup post-Kohli and Rohit's retirements from the format.

title: 'For treatment': Gujarat HC grants bail to Asaram; serving life term in 2013 rape case
content: Godman Asaram has been granted six months' bail by the Gujarat high court for medical treatment, mirroring a similar bail granted by the Rajasthan high court. He is serving a life sentence in the Gujarat case for raping a disciple between 2001 and 2006. Asaram also faces a life sentence in a separate rape case in Rajasthan.

title: IND vs AUS: 4th T20I - India take 2-1 series lead with dominant bowling display
content: India secured an unassailable 2-1 series lead against Australia with a commanding 48-run victory in the fourth T20I. A disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Washington Sundar's exceptional death overs, stifled Australia's chase after they were set a target of 168. This win highlights India's composure and adaptability under captain Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Historic! Sheetal Devi earns spot in able-bodied Asia Cup; first para-archer to do so
content: In a historic first, India's armless para-archer Sheetal Devi has been selected for the Indian able-bodied junior team for the Asia Cup Stage 3. The 18-year-old world champion secured third place in national trials, competing alongside over 60 able-bodied archers. This achievement marks a significant step towards her dream of competing with able-bodied athletes.

title: WPL Retentions: Harman, Smriti, Shafali kept; Lanning, Deepti released ahead of auction
content: WPL franchises unveiled their retained players, with Indian stars Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Shafali Verma headlining the list. Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals kept five players each, while UP Warriorz released several marquee names, including Deepti Sharma. A high-stakes mega auction is set for November 27.

title: US Supreme Court skeptical of Trump tariffs
content: the case could redefine executive authority in an era of economic nationalism . the case, consolidated as Trump vs VOS Selections Inc. and Learning Resources, Inc. v. Trump, is a 'matter of life and death' for the US .

title: Must for all schools to sing state anthem, declares Bengal government
content: 'Banglar Mati, Banglar Jal' is a state song written by Rabindranath Tagore in 1905 . state education minister bratya Basu says the song would be "a catalyst for social and communal unity" the song was composed in support of the movement against the colonial ruler's 1905 partition .

title: Bihar polls: 57.9% turnout in Patna district as young & old come out to vote
content: the district average of 57.93% is a clear rise from 51.12% in 2020 . polling stations in Bankipur, Digha, Kumhrar and Patna Sahib hummed with energy through the day .

title: Maharashtra orders probe into land sale to Ajit son's company
content: 'CM Has Right To Probe': Ajit Pawar's son Parth is one of two partners . the state allegedly waived stamp duty of Rs 21 crore payable for the sale deed registration done in May . a five-member committee has ordered an inquiry into the land deal .

title: Why don't you seek adjournment till I retire, CJI asks government
content: attorney general R Venkataramani made a fresh request for adjournment on Thursday, upsetting CJI B R Gavai . he asked the bench to postpone the hearing scheduled for Friday to Monday . the rebuke from the Supreme Court for seeking reference of petitions challenging the validity of the Tribunal Reforms Act to a five-judge bench .

title: Path to world’s 1st trillionaire: Tesla clears $1,000,000,000,000 pay package for Musk; T&C apply
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: 'It could be, yes': Trump says may visit India next year; calls PM Modi 'great friend'
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: 'Be nice if ... ': Trump warns Mamdani; 'Indo-Pak' alliance in NYC triggers MAGA
content: new york city's mayor-elect, Uganda-born Indian-American Zohran Kwame Mamdani picked UK-born Pakistani-American Lina Maliha Khan to co-chair an all-women transition team as he prepares to govern the world's richest city with socialist zeal . despite his historic win – or perhaps because of it – Mammdani has come under fire from Washington DC straightaway, with an angry president Trump churlishly referring to

title: Modi and Shah have 'unleashed real jungle raj' across India: Rahul
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi accuses PM Modi of spreading hatred to win elections . he urged people to ensure such malpractice does not occur in Bihar . his sister, Priyanka Gandhi, addresses separate rallies in bihar and accused NDA functionaries of vote theft .

title: BBC accused of ‘misleading viewers by doctoring’ Trump speech
content: a leaked dossier revealed that the BBC "doctored footage of US president Donald Trump" in an episode of "Panorama" the programme was broadcast a week before the last US presidential elections . the leaked report by former independent external advisor to the BBC editorial guidelines and standards committee states that in the programme "Trump: a second chance?" broadcast in Oct 2024, the BBC spliced different clips of Trump’s speech outside the Capitol building in Washington .

title: Reveal all convictions or face disqualification: SC
content: 'even if Acquitted, Candidate must disclose offence in nomination form' . the law mandates revealing criminal antecedents operates in full rigour . poonam was unseated from the municipal councillor's post as she was convicted in a cheque bounce case .

title: Garhwal takes a vow: 3 pieces of gold jewellery, no booze at weddings
content: village panchayats in Chakrata's tribal belt and in Uttarkashi's Dunda block enforcing new wedding norms . the rules aim to reduce wedding expenses, end displays of wealth and protect families from rising costs of social expectation .

title: Not getting ‘good response', says judicial panel probing Ladakh violence
content: judicial commission set up by union home ministry to probe the violence in leh, ladakh . it said it was not getting a “good response” from the public, and appealed to the people to come forward and depose before it .
